item.title: 美国考虑对连接中国的路由器巨头 TP-Link 采取行动
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特朗普政府正在考虑是否采取重大举措，限制与中国有关联的路由器制造商 TP-Link Systems Inc.【原文：The Trump administration is considering whether to take a major step toward restricting the US operations of TP-Link Systems Inc., a China-linked router-maker whose Wi-Fi equipment is popular in the American market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 第一国民金融公司准备出售 6 亿加元债券
item.description: 据知情人士透露，加拿大抵押贷款机构第一国民金融公司正准备在下周出售 6 亿加元（约合 4.28 亿美元）的债券，因为它离被私募股权投资者收购的日子越来越近了。【原文：Canadian mortgage lender First National Financial is preparing to sell C$600 million ($428 million) in bonds next week as it moves closer to being bought out by private equity investors, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 比索获准下挫，阿根廷市场松了一口气
item.description: 周四，阿根廷政府本周首次允许比索走软，从而缓解了当地市场的紧张状况，这种紧张状况曾导致收益率飙升，因为阿根廷政府积极买入比索以防止比索暴跌。【原文：Argentina’s government let the peso weaken Thursday for the first time this week, easing strains on the local market that had sent yields surging as it aggressively bought the currency to prevent it from tumbling.】

item.title: YouTubers 因 Covid 被禁，大选误导可能很快卷土重来
item.description: 因违反与 2020 年大选结果或 Covid-19 错误信息等问题相关的政策而被禁止使用该服务的 YouTube 用户可能很快就能重新加入该平台。【原文：YouTube users who were banned from the service for violating its policies related to issues like the 2020 election results or Covid-19 misinformation may soon be able to rejoin the platform.】

item.title: 亚马逊重启面向工人的人工智能代理，与 ChatGPT、Copilot 展开竞争
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在推出其主要商业人工智能工具的升级版，这是该公司为抢占旨在实现办公自动化并加快办公速度的软件市场而做出的最新努力。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is rolling out an updated version of its main artificial intelligence tool for business, the latest effort to grab a slice of the market for software designed to automate and speed up office work.】

item.title: 加拿大 Baytex 能源公司考虑 30 亿美元撤出美国业务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，总部位于加拿大的石油和天然气生产商 Baytex Energy Corp. 正在权衡退出其在得克萨斯州南部鹰福特页岩的业务，以重新专注于国内资产。【原文：Baytex Energy Corp., a Canada-based oil and gas producer, is weighing an exit of its operations in the Eagle Ford shale of south Texas to refocus on its domestic assets, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国稀土股票因政府将继续购买而大涨
item.description: 周四，美国稀土材料矿商的股票大涨，因为中国对稀土出口的限制刺激了对美国稀土产业将从中受益的押注，并有可能刺激联邦政府追加投资。【原文：The rally in shares of US miners of rare-earth materials got a boost Thursday after a China curb on exports of the minerals fueled bets that the American industry will benefit — and potentially spur additional investments from the federal government.】

item.title: 加密齿轮制造商 Bitdeer 变身矿工与客户竞争
item.description: 对于大多数硬件制造商来说，买家需求放缓并没有什么简单的解决办法。但是，在比特币挖矿这一高度神秘的行业中，Bitdeer Technologies Group 等新兴制造商有一张王牌：他们可以自己部署机器。【原文：For most hardware makers, there aren’t any easy answers to a slowdown in buyer demand. But in the highly esoteric business of Bitcoin mining, upstart manufacturers such as Bitdeer Technologies Group have an ace up their sleeve: they can simply deploy their machines themselves.】

item.title: 德国将把芯片工业专用的 30 亿欧元用于道路建设
item.description: 德国政府正在缩减对其半导体产业的财政援助，计划在未来几年内将补贴削减 30 亿欧元（合 35 亿美元），以彻底改造老化的基础设施。【原文：The German government is scaling back financial aid for its semiconductor industry, cutting planned subsidies by €3 billion ($3.5 billion) over the next few years as it seeks to overhaul aging infrastructure.】

item.title: 黄金的忠实信徒曾被嘲笑，如今却迎来了他们的重要时刻
item.description: 他们被称为 "金虫"：这些投资者把金属当作一种商品，而不是商品，更像是一种信条。【原文：They’re known as “gold bugs”: investors who treat the metal less like a commodity and more like a creed.】

item.title: 达拉斯联储博客称美国就业市场再平衡而非疲软
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行的最新研究显示，移民速度放缓意味着美国不需要如此强劲的就业增长来保持失业率稳定，这表明近期的薪资下滑可能并不那么令人担忧。【原文：The slowdown in immigration means the US doesn’t need such robust job gains to keep the unemployment rate stable, suggesting the recent slide in payrolls may not be so worrisome, according to new research from the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas.】

item.title: AMD 产品全军覆没为寻求 3 倍 ETF 的公司敲响警钟
item.description: 就在发行商在美国大张旗鼓地推出高杠杆单一股票 ETF 的当月，大西洋彼岸的一个小产品却向人们展示了这种 ETF 的危险性。【原文：In the month that issuers made a bold push for highly leveraged single-stock ETFs in the US, a tiny product across the Atlantic just showed how dangerous they can be.】

item.title: 马拉松对以 40 美分购入的 First Brands 债务感到 "满意
item.description: 马拉松资产管理公司（Marathon Asset Management LP）首席执行官布鲁斯-理查兹（Bruce Richards）说，马拉松资产管理公司以每美元约 40 美分的价格购买了倒闭的 First Brands 集团的定期贷款，并认为这是一家资产负债表不佳的 "伟大公司"。【原文：Marathon Asset Management LP bought the term loan of collapsed First Brands Group at around 40 cents on the dollar and sees it as a “great company” with a bad balance sheet, Chief Executive Officer Bruce Richards said.】

item.title: 高市口头表示支持，日元获得短暂宽慰
item.description: 日元短暂扭转了跌势，因为日本新执政党领袖高市真奈试图安抚投资者，称她不赞成货币过度疲软。【原文：The yen briefly reversed losses as Japan’s new ruling party leader Sanae Takaichi sought to reassure investors, saying she wasn’t in favor of an excessively weak currency.】

item.title: 埃克萨罗首席执行官称铜矿雄心依旧，但现在更加温和
item.description: 南非煤炭生产商埃克萨罗资源有限公司（Exxaro Resources Ltd.）的新任首席执行官表示，该公司仍希望收购铜矿资产，但自从错失博茨瓦纳的一个铜矿后，该公司的雄心壮志有所减弱。【原文：South African coal producer Exxaro Resources Ltd. still wants to acquire copper assets but has scaled back its ambitions since missing out on a mine in Botswana, the firm’s new chief executive officer said.】

item.title: 灌篮高手出售 9 亿美元以特许经营费为抵押的债券
item.description: 邓肯品牌集团公司（Dunkin' Brands Group Inc.【原文：Dunkin’ Brands Group Inc. sold $900 milllion of bonds backed by the fees it gets from franchising its restaurants, its first such offering in almost four years.】

item.title: OpenAI 警告欧盟反垄断监督机构大科技的数据主导地位
item.description: OpenAI 已向欧盟反垄断执法机构提出了对 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌公司、微软公司和苹果公司等公司潜在有害行为的担忧。【原文：OpenAI has raised concerns with European Union antitrust enforcers over potentially harmful conduct by the likes of Alphabet Inc.’s Google, Microsoft Corp. and Apple Inc.】

item.title: 日本高市否认有意刺激日元进一步走软
item.description: 日本新任执政党党首佐佐江-高市（Sanae Takaichi）回击了有关她赞成日元进一步走软的观点。【原文：Japan’s new ruling party chief Sanae Takaichi pushed back against the view she favors further weakness in the yen, a comment that follows a slump in the currency in the aftermath of her leadership win at the weekend.】

item.title: Meta 799 美元的显示眼镜让人窥见未来：评测
item.description:
社交网络巨头发现了消费者需要认真对待的新类别。【原文：

item.title: 交易员权衡达美航空和百事公司财报，上证 500 指数出现波动
item.description: 周四早盘，美国股市在小幅上涨和下跌之间徘徊，但继续在历史高点附近徘徊，因为交易员们在分析一批财报，主要是达美航空和百事公司的财报，以衡量企业利润的健康状况。【原文：US stocks flipped between small gains and losses early Thursday but continue to hover near all-time highs as traders parsed a batch of earnings reports, mainly from Delta Air Lines and PepsiCo Inc., to gauge the health of corporate profits.】

item.title: 据说沙特财富基金将放慢本地股票销售工作的步伐
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金正在放慢几项计划中的股票销售工作，这可能会影响到沙特数万亿美元经济转型的资金流。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is slowing work on several planned share sales, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially impacting one stream of funding for the kingdom’s multitrillion-dollar economic transformation.】

item.title: 欧洲化学品市场陷入困境，Archroma 债务骤降
item.description: 在一系列交易之后，特种化学品生产商 Archroma 的定期贷款在二级市场大幅下跌，这家由 SK Capital Partners 支持的公司成为该行业情绪恶化的最新受害者。【原文：Specialty chemicals producer Archroma’s term loan has dropped significantly in the secondary market after a series of trades, as the SK Capital Partners-backed firm becomes the latest victim of souring sentiment in the sector.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长埃斯克里瓦警告经济不确定性将达到前所未有的程度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦警告说，目前的不确定性程度是前所未有的。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member José Luis Escrivá warned that the current levels of uncertainty are unprecedented.】

item.title: 莱斯库雷表示，法国将履行实现赤字目标的承诺
item.description: 法国看守财政部长罗兰-莱斯库雷（Roland Lescure）表示，即使在即将卸任的总理塞巴斯蒂安-勒科尔努（Sebastien Lecornu）表示明年的财政整顿力度将小于之前的计划之后，法国仍将履行其对欧盟的预算承诺。【原文：France’s caretaker finance minister, Roland Lescure, said the country is on course to meet its budget promises to the European Union, even after outgoing premier Sebastien Lecornu indicated there will be less fiscal consolidation next year than previously planned.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司推迟化工扩建计划，原因是石油疲软，亚洲成为关注焦点
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，由于油价疲软挤压了当地开支，沙特阿美公司已搁置了三个化学品扩建项目，并优先考虑国际投资。【原文：Saudi Aramco has put three chemicals expansion projects on hold as weaker oil prices squeeze local spending and it prioritizes international investments, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 中国监管机构出台措施遏制价格战
item.description: 中国最高经济规划机构和市场监管部门公布了旨在遏制无序价格竞争的新措施，警告过度的价格战和低于成本的竞标正在损害行业发展，并最终影响中国的经济增长。【原文：China’s top economic planning agency and market regulator have unveiled new measures aimed at curbing disorderly price competition, warning that excessive price wars and below-cost bidding are undermining industry development and ultimately the country’s economic growth.】

item.title: 世界银行敦促肯尼亚提高消费税以援助经济
item.description: 世界银行提出了一系列改革建议，称这将促进肯尼亚经济发展，加快创造就业机会，提高企业竞争力。【原文：The World Bank has recommended a series of reforms it says will boost Kenya’s economy, accelerate job creation, and enhance business competitiveness.】

item.title: Lyft 计划从 2027 年起配备数百辆张量机器人汽车
item.description: Lyft 公司正与自动驾驶汽车开发商 Tensor Auto 公司合作，从 2027 年开始在欧洲和北美部署一支由数百辆机器人axis 组成的车队。【原文：Lyft Inc. is partnering with autonomous vehicle developer Tensor Auto Inc. to deploy a fleet of hundreds of robotaxis in Europe and North America starting in 2027.】

item.title: 英特尔发布新技术，CEO扭亏为盈的关键时刻到了
item.description: 英特尔公司是一家陷入困境的芯片制造商，目前得到了美国政府的支持，该公司推出了新产品和制造技术，这是其扭亏为盈的核心所在。【原文：Intel Corp., the embattled chipmaker now backed by the US government, introduced new products and manufacturing technology that are central to its turnaround bid.】
